org.grouplens.lenskit.vectors

Class Vec

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.grouplens.lenskit.vectors.Vec
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ImmutableVec, MutableVec

    public abstract class Vec
extends Object
implements Serializable
    A real vector. This is a read-only view of a vector of doubles. It is backed by an array, and contains values associated with indices [0,size()).
    Since:
    1.3
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public final double get(int i)
        Get the value from the vector at the specified position.
        Parameters:
        i - The index into the vector.
        Returns:
        The value at index i.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if i is not in the range [0,size()).

      • size

        public final int size()
        Get the dimension of this vector (the number of elements).
        Returns:
        The number of elements in the vector.

      • norm

        public double norm()
        Get the L2 (Euclidean) norm of this vector.
        Returns:
        The Euclidean length of the vector.

      • sum

        public double sum()
        Get the sum of this vector.
        Returns:
        The sum of the elements of the vector.

      • mean

        public double mean()
        Get the mean of this vector.
        Returns:
        The mean of the elements of the vector (or Double.NaN if the vector is empty).

      • dot

        public final double dot(Vec other)
        Compute the dot product of this vector with another.
        Parameters:
        other - The other vector.
        Returns:
        The dot product of this vector and other.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if other.size() != this.size().

      • immutable

        public ImmutableVec immutable()
        Get an immutable vector with this vector's contents. If the vector is already immutable, it is not changed.
        Returns:
        The immutable vector.

      • mutableCopy

        public MutableVec mutableCopy()
        Get a mutable copy of this vector.
        Returns:
        A mutable copy of this vector.
